Found this in November 2019.
tried adding CacheDirectoryGroupReadable 1 to /etc/tor/torrc 

sudo service tor restart
[warn] Failed to parse/validate config: Unknown option 'CacheDirectoryGroupReadable'.  Failing.



fwiw, I'm new to using tor with coding, trying this example > https://www.sylvaindurand.org/use-tor-with-python/

from stem import Signal
from stem.control import Controller

with Controller.from_port(port = 9051) as c:
    c.authenticate()
    c.signal(Signal.NEWNYM)


above code returns this error.
stem.connection.UnreadableCookieFile: Authentication failed: unable to read '/var/run/tor/control.authcookie' ([Errno 13] Permission denied: '/var/run/tor/control.authcookie')


#currently my /etc/tor/torrc only has these lines.
ControlPort 9051                                                                                                                                                                   CookieAuthentication 1     

#stepping back and realising the obvious
ls -la /var/run/tor/control.authcookie
returned 
-rw-r----- 1 debian-tor debian-tor 32 Nov  8 17:22 /var/run/tor/control.authcookie

#so it's obvious how to fix. :)
chmod 777 /var/run/tor/control.authcookie

just leaving this for future alternate versions of me experiencing similar problems to find.
